page.title: 17Industry
page.content: The village of Barwell developed as a near relative to the larger town of Hinckley . The area became well known for its manufacture of footwear and hosiery. As these industries have declined so the character of the village has changed. Many of the old factories have been taken over and used by small companies producing a range of goods. Many lie empty. With the improvement in road travel the village has expanded to accomodate new housing estates of commuters and small supply industries which have speedy access to the motorway network via the M69 motorway.
